intro: Oxybaphus chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean baphus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Oxybaphus chilensis is often found in rocky or coastal areas, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions.
